revised_title: Genetics of Self-Incompatibility in Papaver rhoeas
tldr: The author investigates the genetics of self-incompatibility in the flowering plant Papaver rhoeas. They find that plants fall into two incompatible groups and that reciprocal pollinations are alike, suggesting a gametophytic control of the pollen reaction. However, the data is not conclusive, and further research is needed to determine the type of self-incompatibility system in this species.
